noun.description: A statement or assertion that expresses a judgment or opinion.
examples: the proposition that all men are created equal

noun.description: A suggested scheme or plan of action, especially in a business context.
A project, task, or idea considered in terms of its likely success or difficulty, especially in a commercial context.
examples: a paper that has lost half its readers is unlikely to be an attractive proposition

verb.description: Make a suggestion of sexual intercourse to (someone with whom one is not sexually involved), especially in an unsubtle or offensive way.
examples: she had been propositioned at the party by an accountant

origin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin propositio(n-), from the verb proponere (see propound).
